title: Ticket #5830: Clarify wording re: job router hooks
description:
From Jose Caballero:

here I am again with a question about the documentation in http://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/manual/v8.5/4_4Hooks.html#SECTION00542000000000000000

I read this "Routing is still managed by the condor_job_router daemon, but if the Job Router Hooks are specified, then these hooks will be used to transform and monitor the job instead." That can be interpreted as that, if you sets the hooks (for example the ***_HOOK_TRANSLATE_JOB), that will be the only step used by the JobRouter to manipulate the job classads. But that is not what the code really does. It just applies the HOOK first, not instead. Maybe it can be rephrase in the docs so that is mentioned explicitly? Just an idea....
